Class ServiceOrderManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ServiceOrderManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServiceOrderManagerInterface

    public class ServiceOrderManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements ServiceOrderManagerInterface
    This class creates 3 LinkedLists that contain ServiceOrderInterface objects In order to send and receive information from a GUI to display, add, and delete orders For an auto shop Each LinkedLsit sorts the objects based on different criteria
    Author:
    Adam Holt

        public boolean startService(int orderNum,
                   java.lang.String owner,
                   java.lang.String make,
                   java.lang.String model,
                   int year)
                     throws ServiceOrderInUseException
        Adds a new ServiceOrder object to the LinkedLists based on passed parameters
        Specified by:
        startService in interface ServiceOrderManagerInterface
        Parameters:
        orderNum - The order number
        owner - The name of the owner
        make - The make of the car
        model - The model of the car
        year - The year of the car
        Returns:
        true if the add was successful, otherwise false
        Throws:
        ServiceOrderInUseException
